wikipedia_page.main: Robert Downie VC, MM (12 January 1894 – 18 April 1968) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish Victoria Cross recipients

response: *Robert Downie – recipient of the Victoria Cross
*Sergeant Robert Downie (2nd Battalion) -  First World War, 23 October 1916
*Robert Downie, World War I Victoria Cross recipient
* Downie Township  for Robert Downie, MP.
Robert Downie (19 March 1867 in Glasgow – 27 July 1893) was a Scottish footballer who played for Thornliebank, Third Lanark and Scotland as a goalkeeper. He was a Scottish Cup winner in 1889.
Robert Downie (1894–1968) was a Scottish recipient of the VC for leading a major charge in World War I.
Robert Downie may also refer to:
*Robert Downie (footballer) (1867–1893), Scottish footballer, played for Scotland in 1892
*Robert Downie (rower), British double world champion lightweight rower
